One death from carbon monoxide in public housing is too many. My @AppropsDems bill includes $25 million in additional funds to address carbon monoxide and other dangerous health hazards. Read the report: https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/house-proposes-25-million-fund-co-detectors-other-health-upgrades-n1009011 …

My @AppropsDems funding bill prevents @HUDgov from moving forward with its heartless proposal to kick 55,000 children—all U.S. citizens or legal residents—out of federally-assisted housing. pic.twitter.com/Whyn9sFCOy

This year’s T-HUD bill makes forward-looking investments in our housing and transportation infrastructure, while ensuring concerted attention to safety, the needs of the most vulnerable, and resilience.

I am proud that this legislation lays the groundwork to fully integrate resiliency principles—beyond disaster recovery—into the full range of federal programs that fund transportation and community development projects.

We prioritize assistance for vulnerable pops.  Nearly $200 mill is provided for construction of new housing units for the elderly and disabled. Serving veterans, the homeless, people with AIDS, domestic violence survivors, and youth aging out of foster care are robustly funded

The bill increases the FAA’s aviation safety office budget by 20 percent to ensure there are enough inspectors, engineers, and technicians to oversee the certification process and other vital safety functions.
Our nation is in the midst of an affordable housing crisis, and this bill dedicates new resources to address it.
It makes significant and meaningful investments in three priority areas: infrastructure, safety, and protecting vulnerable populations.

I'm proud to unveil the Fiscal Year 2020 Transportation, Housing and Urban Development, and Related Agencies @AppropsDems bill. This year’s bill represents a positive, inclusive vision for our country that will benefit all Americans. (THREAD)
